SEARCH
Package hms.boundary.doctor

Class CompleteAppointmentView

java.lang.Object
hms.boundary.View
hms.boundary.doctor.UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView
hms.boundary.doctor.CompleteAppointmentView
public class CompleteAppointmentView extends UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView
The CompleteAppointmentView class is responsible for providing the user interface to complete an appointment. It allows the doctor to view appointments, input consultation notes, prescribe medicine, and manage prescriptions.

  • Method Details

    • displayHeader

      public void displayHeader()
      Displays the header for the "Complete Appointment" section. It provides a bordered text representation with the title "Complete Appointment".
      Overrides:
      displayHeader in class UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView

    • displayNoAppointments

      public void displayNoAppointments()
      Displays a message indicating there are no appointments and that the user will return to the main menu.

    • displayApptOptionPrompt

      public int displayApptOptionPrompt(int size)
      Prompts the user to enter the index of the appointment they want to complete.
      Overrides:
      displayApptOptionPrompt in class UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView
      Parameters:
      size - the number of appointments available.
      Returns:
      the index of the selected appointment, or -1 if invalid input is provided.

    • displaySetConsultationNotesPrompt

      public String displaySetConsultationNotesPrompt()
      Prompts the user to enter consultation notes for the appointment.
      Overrides:
      displaySetConsultationNotesPrompt in class UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView
      Returns:
      the consultation notes entered by the user.

    • displayServiceTypePrompt

      public String displayServiceTypePrompt()
      Prompts the user to enter the type of service provided during the appointment.
      Returns:
      the service type entered by the user.

    • displayPrescriptionChoicePrompt

      public int displayPrescriptionChoicePrompt()
      Prompts the user to enter the number of prescriptions to give for the appointment. The number must be between 0 and 999.
      Returns:
      the number of prescriptions to be given, or -1 if invalid input is provided.

    • displayAddPrescriptionNamePrompt

      public int displayAddPrescriptionNamePrompt(int size)
      Prompts the user to select the medicine to be added to the prescription.
      Overrides:
      displayAddPrescriptionNamePrompt in class UpdatePatientMedicalRecordView
      Parameters:
      size - the number of available medicines.
      Returns:
      the index of the selected medicine, or -1 if invalid input is provided.

    • displayAddPrescriptionAmountPrompt

      public int displayAddPrescriptionAmountPrompt()
      Prompts the user to enter the amount of the selected medicine to be prescribed. The amount must be between 1 and 999.
      Returns:
      the amount of the medicine to be prescribed, or -1 if invalid input is provided.

    • SuccessfulPrescription

      public void SuccessfulPrescription()
      Displays a message indicating that the prescription was successfully added.
